From: Jared Isaacman
Sent: Monday, August 29, 2022 9:32 AM
To: Brad Herring; Taylor Lavery; Dave Oder
Subject: Approvals

All,

I have attached a report of all pending approvals from Friday-Sunday. There were 702 total. You can all see I approved 300 of them. So it looks like about 400 are pending.
Most of the delinquencies are >5 days, many > 10 days and some greater than 20-30 days (see last page). This impacts onboarding new customers as well as our cash flow as we have to cover chargebacks.
I know we said we would improve this area - reduce days out, etc. and I don't think we have. I also believe there are a large number of people contributing to merchant app approval backlog.
I would like a plan on what actions we will take to reduce delinquencies going forward and how we will implement some alerting for aged items.

Please keep in mind - every day of delay between chargeback and an active merchant account is more risk. The merchant could drop off a big transaction over a weekend, knowing it will take us Monday+ many
days to approve the account, and they never plan to cover it. We are funding daily - so the risk is completely ours.
Thanks,
Jared

From: Jared Isaacman
Sent: Monday, August 29, 2022 9:51 AM
To: Brad Herring
Subject: Re: Approvals

If we are able to do it - I agree we should.

The goal is to limit losses from delays. It's no different than credit on a payment facilitator agreement. We have to extend some risk.
I want to look at the overall age pending deals now in total.
